subject: Delegation of Power for release of 75% compensation towards Force Majeure Cost Claims arising due to Farmer Agitation as Indirect Political Event under BOT (Toll) Concessions -reg.
text: HRral 744 rTHNf]qferazrut (Tsw wRae7 &k TNArf TAT, 4RGT TAR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) 11q4 *q 61l-5 Q 6, #c7-10, ERd5T, 75f farlt 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 3MV /Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Public Private Partnership/2024 Policy Circular No.8.3.47/ 2024 dated 22nd November , 2024 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. CODIV-19/114/2024-CO Division (Comp. No. 266057)} Sub: Delegation of Power for release of 75% compensation towards Force Majeure Cost Claims arising due to Farmer Agitation as Indirect Political Event under BOT (Toll) Concessions reg: NHAI has issued Policy Guidelines No. 8.3.40 dated 02.07.2021 & its amendment vide Policy Circular No. 8.3.44 dated 19.04.2022 on relief to be provided to BOT (Toll) Concessionaires in connection with forceful stoppage of toll collection at Toll Plazas on NH due to Farmer' s Agitation along with the methodology for calculation of Force Majeure Cost arising due to Farmer Agitation as Indirect Political Event under clause 34.7 of Concession Agreement. 2  As per para 7 of Policy dated 02.07.2021 _ '75% of total claim amount so arrived may be paid immediately s0 as to keep reconciliation margin". Further, as per para 2.6 of Policy dated 19.04.2022, "On Force Majeure Cost, RO will submit their recommendation to Technical Division. Technical Division will obtain the Finance Concurrence and will seek approval of Chairman" 3 In the matter, National Highways Builders Federation (NHBF) has represented that the Concessionaires are constantly struggling with their cashflows due to such intermittent forceful closure of Toll Plazas and requested for compensating the Concessionaire/ Toll Operator on real- time basis. Further, the provision for immediate release of 75% of the claim is not being followed due to lack of clarity regarding Delegation of Powers in this regard. 4_ It is now decided that the delegation of power for release of 75% of Claim Amount to the BOT (Toll) Concessionaires within 30 days from receipt of Claims be assigned to RO concerned: Accordingly, para 7 of policy dated 02.07.2021 is modified as under: 75% of eligible claim amount may be paid to the BOT   (Toll) Concessionaires within 30 days from receipt of Claims after verifying the details, with the approval of RO concerned, SO as to keep reconciliation margin. However, the procedure for release of Compensation towards Final Force Majeure Cost (after appropriate adjustments) shall continue to be governed as per para 2.6 of Policy dated 19.04.2022. 5_ This issues with the approval of Competent Authority. 22| (CS.
